rationale: The agent chose incorrect class names (AbstractAcknowledgedRequest/AbstractAcknowledgedResponse instead of AcknowledgedRequest/AcknowledgedResponse) which fundamentally breaks the refactoring. Ground truth converts the marker interfaces to abstract base classes while keeping the same names, but the agent creates entirely new class names that don't exist in the codebase. This causes: (1) Incorrect inheritance - DeleteWarmerRequest/PutWarmerRequest now extend a non-existent AbstractAcknowledgedRequest instead of the actual AcknowledgedRequest base class, (2) Missing critical implementation in the base classes - the agent didn't add the timeout field, readTimeout/writeTimeout helper methods, or the acknowledgment field and serialization logic to any base class, (3) Incomplete removal of duplicate code - the agent removed timeout methods from request classes but didn't update readFrom/writeTo to use the new helper methods like readTimeout(in, Version.V_0_90_6), leaving the version-checking code in place, (4) DeleteWarmerResponse and PutWarmerResponse extend a non-existent AbstractAcknowledgedResponse and lost all serialization code without gaining it from a proper base class. The ground truth shows the base classes (AcknowledgedRequest/AcknowledgedResponse) should contain the shared timeout/acknowledgment logic with helper methods, but the agent's diff shows no such base class implementation - only references to non-existent abstract classes. This would result in compilation failures.
